About the Position:  Crescent Bank is looking for a Data Scientist who will build models and analyses that lead to a better understanding of how our business performs.     The person in this role will be expected to identify and implement potential solutions that will drive overall performance and profitability of the company. This will include creating analytical frameworks to evaluate solutions to various risks and opportunities related to the business. The person in this role will also be expected to monitor performance of specific business areas and related testing and draw insights for improvement opportunities. In addition, the person in the role will be expected to use analytical techniques to ground the value of different solutions.     What we are looking for:  To find success in this role, a candidate should have a related Bachelor’s degree and related experience. Experience with statistical models and analytical work will also lead to success as well as knowledge of data mining tools such as SQL, SAS, R, and Python.     About Crescent Bank:  Crescent Bank began in 1991 as a small New Orleans based community bank. Today, Crescent Bank has a presence nation-wide and is on a mission to leverage technology to provide auto lending and savings access to consumers who may not be served by other traditional banking products.     Crescent Bank prioritizes employee growth and advancement- both as employees and as individuals- through our core values and through the benefits we offer.     Our Core Values include: Be a Team Player, Continuously Improve, Do the Right Thing, Put the Customer First, & Take Ownership     We are proud to offer the following key benefits:   Workplace flexibility for eligible positions All the insurance programs you’d expect- health, dental, vision, life, disability, + more Multiple types of paid time off Retirement program with company contribution Paid parental Leave Award-winning Wellness programs Tuition Reimbursement Payroll on Demand- access your pay when you need it most.  Learn more about life at Crescent Bank here: Crescent Bank Profile     Additional Information:   Bachelor’s degree in a major with an analytical focus; examples include Engineering, Science, Mathematics, Finance, and Economics. Knowledge of data mining tools such as SQL, SAS, R and Python Analytical and model development skills. Truth seeker / intellectual curiosity Key Skills: results focused, effective communication, attention to detail, relationship builder,  Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled

Job Title:  Data Scientist Type:  Direct Hire Location:  Clearwater, FL or Dallas, TX Experience:  3+ year The data scientist role is within the risk management department and provides analytics with the goal of reducing losses in the payments business. The primary function is to develop statistical models that are used by risk analysts to manage losses from fraud. Roles & Responsibilities  Produce predictive scoring models, typically logistic regression models, to identify transactions with a high probability of resulting in a financial loss Query databases to produce data sets for analysis and reporting Run and modify complex SAS macros for analysis and reporting Determine value of data elements in managing risk in the face of fraud Recommend optimal risk management strategies based on results of analytical research Summarize and present research to peer groups, senior management, and external clients when requested Consult with various groups in the business in the use of decision sciences to improve the effectiveness risk management strategies Most importantly, develop innovative solutions with minimal guidance to meet financial goals  Requirements  Programming skills in SAS (preferred), R, and/or Python Experience querying data using SQL Proven experience applying analytical and problem-solving skills to develop innovative solutions Ability to present analytics to decision makers in a clear and understandable fashion Applied experience in the areas of modeling binary outcomes preferred Ability to complete self-directed analysis Applied knowledge developing predictive models using regression analysis, decision trees, and neural networks a strong plus Master's or PhD in highly quantitative field preferred, relevant certification training also considered; Some experience, could be academic, programming and modeling with SAS 1+ years applied experience using statistical software for data manipulation and analysis  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $110,000.00 - $155,000.00 per year Benefits:  401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Paid time off Vision insurance  Schedule:  8 hour shift Monday to Friday  Supplemental Pay:  Bonus pay  COVID-19 considerations:100% remote in Dallas Education:  Master's (Preferred)  Experience:  Python: 3 years (Preferred) SQL: 3 years (Preferred) Data Scientists & Statisticians: 3 years (Preferred) SAS Viya: 1 year (Preferred) developing predictive models: 1 year (Preferred)  Work Location: One location

Proficient in communicating effectively with both technical and nontechnical stakeholders.  Experience on Cloud platforms such as Azure, AWS, preferred   Join us and be part of something bigger. Apply today!

About GreatSchools.org: GreatSchools is the leading nonprofit providing high-quality information that supports parents pursuing a great education for their child, schools striving for excellence, and communities working to diminish inequities in education. Over 49 million users visit GreatSchools’ award-winning website annually to learn about schools in their area, explore research insights, and access thousands of free, evidence-based parenting resources to support their child’s learning and well-being. We are seeking an entry-level data scientist to join our team. This position reports to our Senior Data Scientist. This is a full-time, exempt remote position based in the U.S. or based in our Oakland, CA office, where we currently operate in a hybrid capacity (mostly remote with the option of coming in a few days a week). *Primary Responsibilities: *  Conduct educational data analyses and develop rating methodologies to ensure accuracy and consistency of output from a documented process. Research, collect, and present statistical models to support GreatSchools’ school quality ratings, and apply them to GS data as approved. Maintain version-controlled rating and analysis scripts and queries using R, Python, and SQL, updating and improving as necessary based on methodology changes or standardization. Build data visualizations to help colleagues and other stakeholders understand data and ratings methodology changes. Contribute to the creation of internally and externally facing reports on a variety of K-12 education issues. Support Data Science teammates as they liaise with other internal teams and external partners in the interpretation of rating methodology implementation to specific cases. This can include preparation, assistance, and/or participation in conversations leading to stakeholder understanding  Experience & Skills:   Skilled with the core technology tools of the Data Science Team at GreatSchools Demonstrated ability with a statistical or data-oriented programming language such as R or Python.  *  SQL - Perform queries of basic to intermediate difficulty.  *  Pluses include familiarity with version control tools such as Git, cloud-based services such as AWS, or package development in R. Training and experience in applying basic statistical models and tests Extremely detail-oriented, organized, and demonstrates strong written and verbal communication for collaboration and documentation. Flexible and creatively-minded, comfortable with ambiguity, and able to think beyond statistical models to generate solutions. A strong communicator who can share technical knowledge in understandable ways with team members of diverse backgrounds and skills. Pluses: Experience working with K-12 education data, predictive analytics, or data science tools. Background coding in R’s tidyverse style, prior work with AWS tools, experience with data visualization software, or working in a non-profit.  About You:   You are inspired by GreatSchools' mission to provide high-quality information that supports parents pursuing a great education for their child, schools striving for excellence, and communities working to diminish inequities in education. You are committed to advancing equity and inclusion both within the organization and for the audiences we serve. Enjoy working on a team of passionate data practitioners in a collaborative environment. Positive work ethic, sense of humor, and contributor to our fun work environment. You have a growth mindset and are excited to learn from and with your team.  Salary & Benefits: The salary for this position ranges from $85,000-$97,000. Our target starting salary is between the minimum and the 25th percentile of this range to ensure there is room for growth over time. Exceptions can be made for significantly more-experienced hires. In addition to salary, we also provide competitive medical, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a retirement plan with an employer match. Additionally, GreatSchools offers generous PTO + sick leave, thirteen paid holidays annually, along with a paid four-week sabbatical every five years. How to Apply: Please submit a cover letter and a résumé via the application link. Your cover letter should include reasons as to why you want to work for GreatSchools.Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. The target start date is July 2022. GreatSchools team members are diverse in all ways. We are committed to hiring talented staff who reflect the diversity of the communities and audiences we serve and who believe in supporting all parents, especially those who have been historically underserved. As a proud Equal Opportunity Employer, we are committed to considering applicants regardless of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $85,000.00 - $97,000.00 per year
